intro: Euploca marifolia subsp. wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan euploca, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly different leaf morphology compared to the main species. It typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, preferring rocky or gravelly soils. This plant is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
